title: Should Dyno Friends go mutli-chain?
body:
To mitigate high gas fees on Ethereum, we can allow collectors to mint on other EVM chains such as Polygon, BSC, FTM, etc. This will also help further our reach throughout the metaverse.

We can retool the minter to detect what chain the wallet is connected to and adjust the frontend, and/or allow the user to choose a chain within the site's UI. Payment on Polygon would be WETH (MATIC token is also needed to pay gas). For BSC, users would only need BNB. Ethereum network fees remain the same. How payment is handled on other chains can be discussed if/when they are added.

The minter can also keep the Dynos in order regardless of which chain they are minted on. So, only 4,400 could be created across chains with no duplicates. So, for instance, once Dyno #500 is minted on Ethereum, you can't mint the same Dyno number on BSC, etc.

The rarity tool can be updated to display Dynos from all chains and even specify which chain they are on.
